scenario: A routine weekday morning at Hong Kong International Airport sees passengers calmly walking to their gates or waiting areas, forming an ambulatory crowd dispersed across the public spaces.
Passengers exiting an arrived flight are leisurely navigating the airport to get to luggage claims and exits. This ambulatory flow sees small gatherings and splitting at intersections.
An inter-terminal subway is functional within the airport, and passengers form an orderly and ambulatory group moving toward the waiting area to board the subway.
A visually impaired traveler accompanied by a guide and airport staff is attempting to reach a transfer gate, creating a disability category scenario.
An elderly group with some wheelchair-bound passengers is aided by airport staff, jovially moving toward the immigration checkpoints.
A deaf and mute traveler struggles to locate their departure gate and seeks assistance, making their way to the nearest information desk.
A group of international tourists, identified with matching hats, explore the central hub of the airport pointing out landmarks and engaging in discussions.
A large family of six is gathered in front of Gate 12, awaiting their boarding time while holding casual conversations.
A group of high school students on a school trip uses a waiting area as a meeting point to verify their boarding passes while preparing for boarding announcements.
A compact group of travelers forms around an artist playing soothing music on their guitar, attracting attention and creating a relaxed expressive atmosphere.
An art exhibition in the center of the terminal attracts a crowd to showcase famous local artists, with people stopping to admire the paintings.
A group of fans at the airport observes a celebrity arriving with enthusiasm, waving and cheering as they gather near the arrival gate.
